New Records: England registered the lowest total on this ground in a one-day international with 156 all out.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka, 160-2, beat England, 156 all out, by eight wickets.
David Willey dismissed Kusal Perera and Kusal Mendis early in the innings.
Pathum Nissanka and Sadeera Samarawickrama both scored half-centuries to steer Sri Lanka to victory.
Pre-Game Insights: England made three changes to their team with the aim of bolstering their batting.
England picked a team without any players younger than 30 for the first time in ODIs.
Post-Match Reflections: England's captain Jos Buttler admitted that the team hit a 'huge low' in the World Cup defeat by Sri Lanka.
The defeat leaves England's World Cup defense in disarray and heading for an early exit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka's captain, Kusal Mendis, celebrated the run out of England’s Adil Rashid with his teammates.
